newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks cling to gains in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks cling to gains in late trade.

text.p: Taiwan share prices remained slightly higher in late Thursday trade as recent bellwether electronics sector continued to attract buyers despite a heavy overnight slump on Wall Street, brokers said.
At 0305 GMT, with 55 minutes left, the index was up 24.55 points or 0.29 percent at 8,451.62. Turnover was T$68 billion.
Electronics led the gains, rising 1.3 percent, with notebook computer maker Inventec rose by the daily seven percent limit to T$353 on expected sound outlook.
Paper and electricals shares were also strong, but financials fell slightly.
Brokers said they expected a firming trend after President Lee Teng-hui on Wednesday called for a cabinet reshuffle, showing the government's determination to crack down on crime.
"I believe the government will not release any bearish news to hit the stock market at a time when it is going to reshuffle the cabinet," said Michael Hung, an independent senior analyst.
Hung said he expected support at 8,400. "The index will likely move firmer to test 8,700 in the near term," he said.
